comment: 'Black develops his pieces sensibly but with no specific aims in view' - Ray Keene commenting on Andersson - Radulov, Nice 1974. In that game Black played b6 and Bb7 but the salient feature is the same. White's control of e5. Black's best plan involves f6 and e5, as Alex Nisbet demonstrated to me in the SCCA Championship 1997-98.
reasoning: The comment explains the mistake made by the player as it highlights the lack of specific aims in Black's play and suggests a better plan involving f6 and e5.
